html:
8 S.Ct. 1394

127 U.S. 773

32 L.Ed. 323

SEAGRIST
v.
CRABTREE.1

April 16, 1888.

O. D. Barrett, for plaintiff in error.

J. G. Zachry, for defendant in error.

MILLER, J.

1

This is a motion to dismiss, the ground for which is that the citation was served and made returnable less than 30 days after the writ was granted. We do not think that is a sufficient ground to dismiss the writ of error, whatever may be the ground for relief.

1

Former opinion, 6 Pac. Rep. 202.

CRABTREE.

Submitted April 9, 1888.
Decided April 16, 1888.
ERROR TO THE SUPREME COURT OF THE TERRITORY OF NEW MEXICO.

Mr. J.G. Zachry for the motion.

*774 MR. JUSTICE MILLER:

This is a motion to dismiss, the ground for which is that the citation was served and made returnable less than thirty days after the writ was granted. We do not think that is a sufficient ground to dismiss the writ of error, whatever may be the ground for relief.
